I remember one of the first Litecoin transaction that I did in December 2011. I got some acrylic Litecoin pieces from Mike Caldwell. (Casacius coin creator) I decided to do a giveaway but people only need to pay me for shipping cost of $0.44 or 70 LTC. I "sold" 12 of these. pic.twitter.com/T4QjrGciOm

First of all, I'm not bashing Verge. Just commenting on an attack that's going on. Secondly, we could partner with TolenPay or even Verge in the future. I'm not going to hold back and not speak the truth even if the Litecoin Foundation has a partnership.
Litecoin is secured, decentralized, censorship-resistance, cheap and fast.
I believe Litecoin is a better coin and will outperform BCH in the long run. I couldn't predict prices in the short term.

Ripple is positioning XRP to be used for settlement and you are thinking of payments. Ripple is also positioning XRP to provide on-demand liquidity to market makers.

Whatever you can do with any other crypto, you can do with XRP -and you can do it cheaper and faster. There is no reason to assume that whatever Ripple is championing XRP for will be the only use case. People can use XRP and/or any other crypto for whatever they want.

Before anyone gets bent out of shape about PoW criticism, here's a final thought experiment: suppose there was a unicorn that could do everything Bitcoin could do, as securely, but used 1/1000th its energy. Would you switch to it, or would you burn the energy for the hell of it?

I don't view Satoshi's word as scripture and don't believe the community should either. Things were very different early on, including the context of discussions and the assumptions made. The whole point of bitcoin is we have no leader.
Yup there was a discussion on zero conf for micropayments, but this predates Satoshi's work on payment channels. https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1786.msg22119#msg22119 …
It exists and I support it. # bitcoin

Somehow DSN's excellent Bitcoin network monitoring site (https://dsn.tm.kit.edu/bitcoin/index.html …) has flown under my radar; I'm adding it to https://lopp.net/bitcoin.html  Note that tx propagation is intentionally slower today; this is due to privacy improvements to make network analysis more difficultpic.twitter.com/YmN8mCJK0z
